messageBody:
Robert Lucente wrote:
> Googled and found http://www.w3.org/DOM/Test/Documents/DOMTSBuild.html.
>
> The above states, "If you get a out of memory error (very likely if you
> build the DOM Level 3 Core tests)". It then recommends "set
> ANT_OPTS=-Xmx512M". Request that people share how they solved their "out of
> memory" issue.
>
> Humm. This does belong in JUnit ? Perhaps this is a generic Java question ?

Allocating more memory is one way to work around an OutOfMemoryError,
but it's rarely the only solution, and if it's not the only solution,
it's rarely the best one.

...and yes, this is a generic Java solution to a generic Java question.
Another solution is to look for ways to use less memory, such as lazily
instantiating objects and letting them be collected as garbage as soon
as possible.
